required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validity of Fluorescence-Based Devices Versus Visual-Tactile Method in Detection of Secondary Caries Around Resin Composite Restorations: Invivo Diagnostic Accuracy Study
clinical_study.official_title: Validity of Fluorescence-Based Devices Versus Visual-Tactile Method in Detection of Secondary Caries Around Resin Composite Restorations: Invivo Diagnostic Accuracy Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted to evaluate the clinical performance and validity of both light-induced fluorescence intraoral camera and laser-induced fluorescence device in comparison to visual-tactile assessment method in detection of secondary caries around margins of resin composite restorations.

detailed_description.textblock: Each patient should have at least one resin composite restoration. The restoration will be evaluated by all diagnostic methods. Each examiner will independently record the dental findings using all methods, the visual- tactile assessment method and both fluorescent-aided identification methods. The visual-tactile assessment method includes the use of mirror, probe under good illumination condition, while the fluorescent-aided identification methods will be performed by both light-induced fluorescence intraoral camera and laser-induced fluorescence device. Then Diagnostic performance for caries detection was evaluated, assessing the validity of each diagnostic method in diagnosing secondary caries around margins of resin composite restorations

study_design_info.masking_description: The assessors will not be blind about the type of intervention/control assessment methods. However it will not be allowed amongst the examiners to exchange any information throughout the entire study period

primary_outcome.measure: Validity of Fluorescence-based Devices versus Visual-tactile method
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: Diagnostic performance for caries detection was evaluated, assessing the validity of each diagnostic method in diagnosing secondary caries around margins of resin composite restorations in terms of sensitivity and specificity.

clinical_study.condition: Secondary Caries Around Resin Composite Restorations

arm_group.arm_group_label: Visual-tactile assessment method according to FDI criteria

intervention.description: Each restoration margins will be assessed by Light induced fluorescence intraoral camera to assess its validity in diagnosing secondary caries around margins of resin composite restorations
Each restoration margins will be assessed by Laser-induced fluorescence device to assess its validity in diagnosing secondary caries around margins of resin composite restorations

intervention.intervention_name: Visual-tactile assessment method according to FDI criteria
intervention.description: Each restoration margins will be assessed by visual-tactile assessment method which includes the use of mirror, probe under good illumination condition to assess its validity in diagnosing secondary caries around margins of resin composite restorations
intervention.arm_group_label: Visual-tactile assessment method according to FDI criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients should be over 18 years of age.
- Patients should have an acceptable oral hygiene level.
- Patients should have at least one resin composite restoration.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a compromised medical history.
- Patients with active severe periodontal disease.

overall_contact.last_name: Aya Mohamed Adly Ibrahim, Master's Degree
